instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that is not charging.

I have 12.55V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> w/o battery, and 8.96V with battery connected.

Diode readings:
SCL= 0.543
SDA= 0.536 

<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>= 1,979 ohms
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>= 1,996 ohms 

Already removed <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> but same result.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
"8.96V with battery connected."
Battery alone (no charger)?

Did you try disconnecting BIL?
Is the battery recognized by macOS?
Tried known good battery?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Hi,

8.96V with battery, and charger connected. W/O charger 11.19V

Now I'm testing it with just the board on the bench, and w/o BIL

The battery isen't recognized on the macOS, and alreay tried a known good battery.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message: Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is good.

Try changing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
If still the same, change SMC...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR>  it's OK.

I've replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, but  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is increasing voltage with battery connected. Started at 8.9V and now is at 11V. Shouldn't it be decreasing?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
With charger and battery connected, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> slowly increases when battery is charging.
Once battery is fully charged, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should go to 12.5V and Magsafe light switches from amber to green.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
HI,

I'm going to replace the SMC.

Strangly, it seams that the battery is charging, but the mac don't work with battery alone.  If I unplug the charger power cable, it loses image, the the fan keeps spining (witch indicates that it has battery). It seams that it hibernates when the charger is unpluged, because if i plug the power again, un push the power button, it is still in the desktop.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  increased at 12.5V, but the battery isen't recognized in the OS...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message: I've replaced the SMC and now it charges the battery, but only withou the LID connected. Is there any way to solve this?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3V with BIL connected?
Check SCL/SDA lines w/ and w/o BIL connected; voltage and diode mode to ground.
